member.name: IAccessibilityDockingService.DockWindow
member.summary: Docks the specified window handle to the specified monitor handle.
member.param: The accessibility application window that will be docked on the passed monitor handle.
The monitor on which the accessibility application window will be docked.

param.name: pCallback
param.para: The callback pointer on which the accessibility application will receive the notification.
The height at which the window will be docked, in pixels, if this function is successful. Must be less than or equal to the puMaxHeight variable retrieved from a call to the GetAvailableSize method.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The window handle or monitor handle is not valid.
The calling process is not a UIAcess accessibility application or the calling process does not own the window.
There is already another window occupying the docking space. Only one window can be docked at a time.

The requested uHeight is larger than the maximum allowed docking height for the specified monitor. However, if this error code is being returned, it means that this monitor does support docking, though at a height indicated by a call to the GetAvailableSize method.
The monitor specified by the monitor handle does not support docking.

member.name: IAccessibilityDockingService.GetAvailableSize
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions available on a specific screen for displaying an accessibility window.
member.param: The handle of the monitor whose available docking size is to be retrieved. For information on how to retrieve an HMONITOR, see .

param.name: pcxFixed
param.para: When this method returns successfully, this parameter receives the fixed width, in physical pixels, available for docking on the specified monitor. Any window docked to this monitor will be sized to this width.
If the method fails, this value is set to 0.
If this value is NULL, an access violation will occur.

param.name: pcyMax
param.para: When this method returns successfully, this parameter receives the maximum height, in physical pixels, available for a docked window on the specified monitor.
If the method fails, this value is set to 0.
If this value is NULL, an access violation will occur.

returns.para: Returns a standard return value, including the following:

listheader.description: The monitor specified by hMonitor does not support docking.

member.name: IAccessibilityDockingService.UndockWindow
member.summary: Undocks the specified window handle if it is currently docked.
member.param: Specifies the window that will be undocked.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The window does not belong to the calling process.

member.name: IAccessibilityDockingService
member.summary: Docks an application window to the bottom of a monitor when a Windows Store app is visible and not snapped, or when the launcher is visible.
